meanings.definition: A gesture, action, or sound used to convey information or instructions.
meanings.sent1: She gave me a thumbs-up as a signal to start.
meanings.sent2: The traffic light turned red, signaling us to stop.
meanings.sent3: His loud sneeze was a signal for everyone to say 'bless you'.
meanings.sent4: The sudden silence in the room signaled that something was wrong.
meanings.sent5: The ringing bell signaled the end of the school day.

meanings.definition: An event or act that serves as a sign or indication.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds were a signal of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: His smile was a signal of his happiness.
meanings.sent3: The broken umbrella was a signal that it was time to buy a new one.
meanings.sent4: The cheers from the crowd were a signal of their support.
meanings.sent5: The early morning chirping of birds was a signal of the new day.

meanings.definition: A device or means of communication, such as a flag or light, used to transmit information.
meanings.sent1: The lighthouse emits signals to guide ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent2: The flag on the ship was a signal of distress.
meanings.sent3: The smoke signals from the campfire were a creative way to communicate.
meanings.sent4: The flashing lights on the police car were signals for other drivers to move aside.
meanings.sent5: The radio waves carry signals to our phones for communication.
